snippet: The Metropolitan Transportation Authority said Friday that it would not contest the purchase; the ads were the subject of a lawsuit after they were initially rejected by the authority.
abstract: Metropolitan Transportation Authority says it will not contest the latest purchase of advertisements from American Freedom Defense Initiative, a group behind controversial subway ads urging riders to 'support Israel' and 'defeat jihad' that were initially rejected by the authority; group sued, and in July won a federal court ruling on First Amendment grounds.
lead_paragraph: The Metropolitan Transportation Authority said Friday that it would not contest the purchase; the ads were the subject of a lawsuit after they were initially rejected by the authority.

headline.seo: Pro-Israel Subway Ads Will Appear on New York City Buses
headline.main: Controversial Pro-Israel Ad Campaign to Expand to Buses
headline.print_headline: Controversial Pro-Israel Ad Campaign to Expand to Buses
